description: President Donald Trump commuted the criminal sentence of Ozy Media founder Carlos Watson on Friday, just hours before he was due to begin serving the sentence for a multi-million-dollar scheme, a senior White House official said.
title: Trump commutes sentence of Ozy Media founder Carlos Watson

description: Rapper Sean Kingston and his mother were found guilty on all counts in their federal wire fraud trial in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, on Friday.
title: Rapper Sean Kingston and his mother guilty of fraud

description: Three American women who were discovered dead in a Belize resort hotel room last month died from carbon monoxide poisoning, their families said.
title: 3 Americans in Belize died from carbon monoxide in hotel room, officials say

description: A New Jersey mayor was filmed stumbling and losing her balance as she was arrested for drunk driving with her young son in the car on St. Patrick's Day.
title: Video shows New Jersey mayor stumbling during drunk driving arrest with young son in car

description: Dave Portnoy, a Trump supporter and the founder of Barstool Sports, went viral for his blistering critique of the administration’s group chat debacle
title: The White House's Barstool problem

description: Model Bri Stern spoke to NBC News after filing a civil lawsuit against self-proclaimed misogynist influencer Andrew Tate, alleging abuse and threats during their 10-month relationship. In an interview with Chloe Melas, Stern claims the relationship culminated in a violent sexual encounter at a Beverly Hills hotel, which she says left her fearing for her life.
title: 'I was scared to death': Andrew Tate accuser speaks out on alleged abuse

description: Remarks by liberal Justice Sonia Sotomayor came as President Donald Trump and his allies have harshly criticized judges for blocking his second term agenda.
title: Justice Sonia Sotomayor defends 'fearlessly independent' judiciary amid Trump attacks

description: In today’s edition, we take you behind the scenes of President Donald Trump’s sudden move to withdraw Elise Stefanik’s U.N. ambassador nomination.
title: Behind the scenes of Trump's sudden move to withdraw Elise Stefanik's nomination: From the Politics Desk

description: Elon Musk said Friday that his AI startup, xAI, had acquired his social media platform, X. Musk said that the deal was an all-stock transaction that valued X at $33 billion.
title: Elon Musk's AI startup acquires X in deal that values social media platform at $33 billion

description: President Donald Trump’s expanding trade war is ricocheting through corporate boardrooms and driving up economic pessimism at kitchen tables.
title: Consumers call for a lifeline as Trump's tariff 'Liberation Day' nears

description: U.S. District Judge Brian Murphy in Boston issued a nationwide temporary restraining order designed to protect migrants subject to final orders of removal.
title: Federal judge blocks Trump administration from fast-tracking deportations

description: The move came amid growing anxiety about the House GOP’s narrow margins and a Florida special election that’s been more competitive than expected.
title: Inside Trump's shock decision to pull the plug on Elise Stefanik's nomination

description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. — Taxpayer-funded staffers in Florida Gov.
title: Taxpayer-funded staffers for Ron DeSantis solicit lobbyist cash as his wife considers a 2026 run

description: Fueled by the measles outbreak in Texas, U.S. cases this year now exceed 500 — the second-highest annual total in a decade. In Texas alone, 400 cases have been confirmed.
title: Growing measles outbreak in Texas pushes U.S. cases above 520

description: A Florida death row inmate who was convicted of kidnapping and killing a woman in 2000 is asking the court to show him leniency regarding his execution, scheduled for early next month, because he is "morbidly obese."
title: Florida death row inmate says his morbid obesity would 'complicate' lethal injection, wants leniency

description: The Federal Communications Commission has alerted the Walt Disney Company and its ABC unit that it will begin an investigation into the diversity, equity and inclusion efforts at the media giant.
title: FCC is investigating Disney and ABC for DEI initiatives

description: The Justice Department has submitted multiple filings with the Supreme Court that accuse federal judges of abusing their constitutional powers, while lower courts criticized the Trump administration’s expansive view of presidential power.
title: Trump turns to Supreme Court as judges push back on the administration's view of presidential power

description: The Federal Reserve’s key inflation measure rose more than expected in February while consumer spending also posted a smaller-than-projected increase, the Commerce Department reported Friday.
title: Core inflation in February hits 2.8%, higher than expected; spending increases 0.4%

description: Immigrant children who survived sex abuse are being stripped of legal aid to help them stay in the U.S. due to HHS federal funding cuts, according to legal groups.
title: Legal groups helping immigrant children who survived sex trafficking, abuse sue to regain federal funding

description: Over 600 members of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences have signed an open letter criticizing the Academy for their lack of public support for Palestinian filmmaker Hamdan Ballal, co-director of the Oscar-winning documentary.
title: Sandra Oh, Mark Ruffalo, Ava DuVernay among 600 Oscar voters criticizing lack of  Academy support for Hamdan Ballal

description: Charlie Javice, the woman accused of swindling JPMorgan Chase into acquiring her now-shuttered college financial aid company, was found guilty on Friday.
title: Charlie Javice, college financial aid startup founder, found guilty of defrauding JPMorgan

description: During his visit to a military base in Greenland, Vice President Vance said the territory was "extremely vulnerable" and that it could be "much more secure" if they partner with the United States.
title: Vance: Greenland would be 'much more secure' if it partners with the U.S.

description: Colorado coach Deion Sanders has received a contract extension through the 2029 season after turning around a downtrodden program in just two seasons.
title: Deion Sanders signs contract extension at Colorado that pays him $10 million a year

description: President Trump addressed his decision to ask Rep. Elise Stefanik, R-N.Y., to remain in Congress after he had previously nominated her to be the U.S. ambassador to the United Nations. He said that due to the slim margin and the fact she is popular in her district, "we cannot take a chance."
title: Trump speaks on pulling Stefanik's U.N. ambassador nomination

description: Renewed inflation fears, plummeting consumer confidence and rising doubts about the payoff from artificial intelligence touched off a fresh round of heavy selling in stocks Friday.
title: Inflation, tariffs fears rattle stocks as they head for fifth losing week in the past six

description: PORTLAND, Maine — The administration of President Donald Trump is investigating Maine with a claim that dozens of school districts in the state violate federal law by withholding information about students’ gender transitioning from parents.
title: Trump administration investigates Maine for claims of withholding gender transitions from parents

description: The doctor accused of trying to kill his wife while hiking in Hawaii only stopped his rock-beating, syringe-wielding attack when fellow hikers happened on to the scene, according to court documents revealed on Thursday.
title: Wife of Hawaii doctor says she screamed to hikers for help amid vicious rock-beating

description: The FBI is investigating the death of a National Park Service worker who law enforcement found with "severe injuries" last week, according the National Park Service.
title: Yosemite National Park worker dies after being found with severe injuries

description: President Donald Trump moved Thursday to end collective bargaining with federal labor unions in agencies with national security missions across the federal government, citing authority granted him under a 1978 law.
title: Trump signs executive order to end collective bargaining at agencies involved with national security

description: The Memphis Grizzlies have parted ways with their winningest coach, Taylor Jenkins, with the team struggling down the stretch and at risk of losing home-court advantage for the postseason.
title: Memphis Grizzlies fire head coach Taylor Jenkins despite team's winning season

description: At least 144 people have been killed and over 730 others have been injured after a 7.7-magnitude earthquake struck Myanmar with tremors felt in Thailand and neighboring countries. NBC News' Raf Sanchez reports on the devastation caused by the powerful quake.
title: At least 144 dead and hundreds injured after Myanmar earthquake

description: The Department of Justice has asked the Supreme Court to overturn Judge Boasberg's order that has paused deportations under the Alien Enemies Act.
title: DOJ asks Supreme Court to lift order pausing deportations under Alien Enemies Act

description: Will Smith is back to making tunes that "slaps" after dropping "Based on a True Story" on Friday, following a 20-year hiatus from music — and he immediately addresses his infamous Oscars incident with Chris Rock in 2022.
title: Will Smith raps about slapping Chris Rock at Oscars on new album

description: Lululemon beat Wall Street expectations for fiscal fourth-quarter earnings and revenue, but issued 2025 guidance that disappointed analysts.
title: Lululemon shares drop 15% as CEO says inflation, economic concerns are weighing on spending

description: President Trump has announced 25% auto tariffs will be imposed on all vehicles and vehicle parts not made in the U.S. starting April 3.
title: Here are the automobile makes and models that would be the most affected by Trump's tariffs

description: Barry Ritholtz had a hard time writing his first book, “Bailout Nation.”
title: Investors will be 'miles ahead' if they avoid these 3 things, 'How Not to Invest' author says

description: Mass layoffs are expected to begin at HHS, hitting workers at agencies including the CDC, FDA and NIH. The firings come under health secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: Mass layoffs expected to begin at health agencies as Kennedy agenda takes shape

description: Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev is betting that by rolling out a large enough portfolio of digital investment products, more consumers will be willing to pay a monthly subscription for its product suite.
title: Robinhood CEO sees Amazon-like subscription model as path to 'loyalty' in financial services

description: The case against Kimberly Sullivan, a Connecticut woman accused of keeping her stepson a prisoner in their home for decades, will include a friend who claims the stepmom never mentioned him for 21 years, a prosecutor said Friday.
title: Friend of Connecticut woman, accused of imprisoning stepson, says she never mentioned him for 21 years

description: Tech billionaire and White House adviser Elon Musk will head to Wisconsin days before the pivotal state Supreme Court election there, into which he's sunk millions of dollars on behalf of the conservative candidate and become a central figure in the race.
title: Elon Musk to travel to Wisconsin ahead of critical state Supreme Court election

description: The calendar hasn’t yet turned to April, but one of the more memorable moments of the Major League Baseball season has already taken place.
title: Yankees player J.C. Escarra’s mother recalls reaction to him making the team

description: A U.S. judge in Washington state has blocked enforcement of President Donald Trump’s order banning transgender people from serving in the military, the second nationwide injunction against the policy in as many weeks.
title: Another federal judge blocks Trump policy banning transgender troops in the military

description: Lawyers for Mahmoud Khalil, a Columbia University graduate student facing deportation because of his pro-Palestinian activism on campus, will appear in court on Friday.
title: Mahmoud Khalil's lawyers to appear in court as judge weighs whether to move case to Louisiana

description: Utah is the first state to ban fluoride in public water, after Gov. Spencer Cox signed a bill prohibiting the addition of the mineral, which can prevent tooth decay, into water systems.
title: Utah becomes first state to ban fluoride in public water

description: TAMPA, Fla. — It’s a race against the clock for the Tampa Bay Rays as they prepare to open their doors to fans at their temporary new home this Major League Baseball season.
title: Inside the Tampa Bay Rays' rush to transform a spring training field to an MLB ballpark

description: A Russian medical researcher at Harvard University is being detained at a Louisiana immigration facility after her visa was revoked last month over undeclared frog embryo samples found in her luggage, her lawyer told NBC News.
title: Russian medical researcher at Harvard, who protested the Ukraine war, detained by ICE

description: Duke's star freshman Cooper Flagg has been the consensus top pick in the upcoming NBA draft since before the season started.
title: The hype around Duke's Cooper Flagg shows no signs of stopping

description: Actor Constance Wu is back on the big screen with her first role in three years.
title: Constance Wu is worried about backsliding of Hollywood diversity amid DEI rollbacks

description: Vice President JD Vance is set to land in Greenland to a chorus of anger and anxiety at White House plans to seize the Arctic territory by any means necessary.
title: As Vance heads for Greenland, Trump's land-grab hopes get Putin thumbs-up

description: With some of the Trump administration's new tariffs set to take effect next week, NBC’s Brian Cheung joins TODAY with products, from cars to tech, that you should (and shouldn’t) consider buying now.
title: Buyer's guide to new tariffs: What to buy and when

description: JD Vance and second lady visit Greenland
title: JD Vance and second lady visit Greenland

description: The White House is targeting foreign-born students for deportation.
title: Hundreds of student visas revoked and Greenlanders' anti-American sentiment: Morning Rundown

description: An attorney for Rumeysa Ozturk, the Tufts University graduate student who was arrested in the street Tuesday by plain clothes immigration officers and had her visa revoked, says federal officers are intentionally targeting Muslim students during the holy month of Ramadan.
title: Detained Tufts student's lawyer says immigration officials are 'stalking Muslim students' during Ramadan

description: Republicans are looking to add two more seats to their House majority after special elections in Florida next week, giving GOP leaders a little more breathing room in a tightly divided legislative chamber.
title: GOP 'anxiety' persists ahead of Florida special elections in Trump territory

description: President Donald Trump’s moves in Washington are being felt in the milking barns of an upstate New York dairy farm.
title: How milk is getting caught in the middle of Trump's policy agenda

description: Tesla has become a lightning rod for violent attacks and vandalism in the months since CEO Elon Musk joined the Trump administration.
title: More than 200 Tesla protests planned this weekend after series of violent incidents

description: Now preparing for his seventh mayoral campaign, Everett Mayor Carlo DeMaria is accused of padding his salary with bonus payments and this time, the state of Massachusetts is pressing the City Council to take action.
title: Massachusetts mayor who shuttered a libelous newspaper faces renewed corruption allegations

description: A federal judge in Denver is set to hear arguments Friday over whether an immigration and labor activist who took refuge in Colorado churches to avoid deportation during the first Trump administration should be freed from detention.
title: Federal judge to consider releasing immigration activist who took refuge in churches

description: Darrion Williams scored the tiebreaking basket with 7.3 seconds left in overtime after tying the game with a 3-pointer in the closing seconds of regulation to lead Texas Tech to an 85-83 win over Arkansas on Thursday night and a spot in the Elite Eight.
title: Texas Tech rallies to beat Arkansas 85-83 in OT to advance to Elite Eight

description: Even after transforming hundreds of lawns — and doing it for nearly 40 million social media followers — this week's job had this viral star nervous.
title: Viral star known for good deeds has a field day with Kansas City Royals' request for opening day help

description: The order states that Vice President JD Vance will be in charge of efforts to prohibit federal funding for Smithsonian programs that are not in line with the administration's goals.
title: Trump targets 'improper ideology' at Smithsonian museums in new executive order

description: The Trump administration has been targeting foreign-born graduate and doctoral students whose main transgression seems to be activism.
title: Trump takes aim at foreign-born college students, with 300 visas revoked

description: Seven members of the Department of Government Efficiency broke their media blockade and sat for a group interview with Fox News.
title: Elon Musk's DOGE tries to put new faces on its reclusive federal office
